intro: Ubochea, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soil and thrives in bright, indirect light. Ubochea species are popular houseplants due to their vibrant blooms and relatively easy care requirements. They are also known for their ability to produce offsets, which can be used for propagation.
